newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian computer firm Pennu set for public offer.
newsitem.headline: Estonian computer firm Pennu set for public offer.

text.p: Estonia's Pennu computer company is to launch the second stage of a share issue, which aims to raise a total 6.88 million Estonian kroons, arrangers Cresco Securities investment house said on Friday.
The second stage of the issue is an open offer and is aimed at Estonian institutions and the public. It will consist of 108,718 shares at 43 kroons each and will start on August 26.
The first part of offer, which met demand from U.S. and U.K. investors, was for 51,282 shares, also at 43 kroons. It was 2.5 times oversubscribed.
Pennu is the second largest computer firm in Estonia and recently concluded a deal with U.S. firm Western Digital to build a hard disc repair facility to service eastern Europe.
Cresco said Pennu aimed to list its shares on the free list of the Tallinn stock exchange in late September.
